Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Ivonne33
Reviews.Content: My brother and I enjoyed this hotel, we spent a weekend in Paris and found this little hotel very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, cosy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: oohmercyme
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this cosy hotel for two nights in a twin room. Staff were very friendly and welcoming- seemed to genuinely care about their guests. Our room was off to the side of the lobby and lift and I was concerned it would be noisy, but it was very quiet. Our room had a door out into a little courtyard which was nice. Very close to a metro station, several cafes, and a wonderful high end grocery store. Hotel was clean and comfortable, staff were great- would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money (for Paris)”
Reviews.Author: Liketotravel38
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here for 13 days in August. We booked a standard room which was small but manageable for two people. Small desk, small stocked refrigerator, luggage rack and armoire with ample hangers and shelves. Bathroom was small but very nice and clean with marble tiles, hair dryer and sufficient space for toiletries. The shower stall was excellent. Sliding doors which actually kept the water in the shower. Plenty of hot water and pressure. Room had AC which worked very well once we figured out controls. We only needed AC for 2 nights. Room was on the 3rd floor facing the street. Relatively quiet area at night. We were able to keep window open at night and heard little street noise (except in the morning when garbage truck briefly comes by ). Free wi-fi which worked every day. Hotel has a small but modern elevator. It will fit two adults and two pieces of luggage or 4 adults that want to get close and personal for a few seconds. The hotel was relatively quiet at nights but you can hear faint voices coming from other rooms. Not a real issue. We had 3 electrical outlets so we could charge all our electronics at night. We booked via email and paid much less than the stated price on their website. As our trip progressed, we stopped in a few other 3 star hotels to check prices and never found comparable hotel for less. The immediate vicinity around the hotel seemed safe, quiet and clean but not really all that “quaint”. It’s not a café-rich area that one would want to stroll around. Really need to hop on the subway to get to those parts of Paris. Notre Dame is 4 metro stops away. Hotel is not really within walking distance of major sites (can walk to St. Sulpice and Luxembourg gardens) but it is a block away from two metro stations/lines, Sevres Babylone and Placide. This was very handy and we could reduce subway connections by selecting the best line for our given destination. We did not purchase the breakfast so can not comment. There is a small boulangrie two doors down where we could get assorted croissants before we started our day. Just down the street is the Bon Marche supermarket. It’s a high-end supermarket which has all sorts of interesting foods. You can also get croissants and other bakery items there as well. There is a café on the corner (Nemrod) where we had breakfast once. Also two cafés near the Placide subway stop where we also had breakfast (reasonably priced delicious ham & cheese omelets but beware of the $8 pressed orange juice). Would definitely recommend this hotel to others and we would stay here again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay, great location. Highly recomended!!”
Reviews.Author: OrBenBarak
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 5 night stay in Paris, in hotel Sevres Saint Germain. We arrived at 10a.m. after a long night without sleep, and the fact that our room was ready for us really saved our first day in Paris! The room is a kinda small but is quite OK, and the free WiFi is a real purke!! The staff was really nice and helpfull and the room was kept clean and tidy throughout our stay. The best thing is the wonderful location. We absolutely adored the neighbourhood, all the small cafes around and it was easy to go everywhere in Paris from there. In a nutshell, great value for the price we paid, recomended for a taste of real parisian living...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Vanilla_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in PAris. The location is EXCELLENT, close to two Metro stops and away from the bustle of most of Paris. Room was typically small, especially the bathroom, but that is expected in Europe. Boutiques were right around the corner. The value of the hotel was excellent. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Skip the optional 15 euro breakfast- there is a boulangerie right next door that has a fabulous selection, and several cafes within short walking distance. Taxi to Charles de Gaulle was about 60 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: APDRM
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed very much our stay at Sevres Saint German. The rooms are beautifully decorated and clean; however ours was a bit dark. The hotel staff is very nice and helpful. The location is excellent! The breakfast is not great value for money. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Doozey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business and was already booked for us. Initially the hotel seemed very expensive but after researching other hotels in the region this hotel is reasonably priced. The area has a raft of good eating places within close proximity, catering for tastes and prices. Be warned though a quick beer in Paris isn't cheap. For two beers we were charged 18 euros! The rooms, whilst small had everything for a three star hotel. The only moan would be that the aircon next to the head of the bed was a bit annoying as it blew air over your face as you tried to sleep. Didn't have breakfast as it was 15 euros and there was a great patisserie just next door! Would certainly recommend this hotel when on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “not sure what the fuss is about”
Reviews.Author: camva
Reviews.Content: We had a "superior room" and it was tiny. I confirmed that it was a superior room because I was surprised by the size. I am familiar with Paris hotels so that isn't the issue. The staff were nice enough and the location was good but I wouldn't rush to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ch0gi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2009 and it was so nice that we wanted to stay there again this year. Unfortunately, they were booked out so had to go somewhere else. The hotel looks lovely. Rooms are small but that's as expected. The room and bathroom were spotless. We did have to wait for our room until 3:30pm even though, when we arrived in the morning, we were told it would be ready by 2pm.The lady behind the reception wasn't the friendliest face on Earth but she was helpful when needed. Hotel location was wonderful. The area is beautiful and even though it's a bit of a walk to all the attraction, it was a pleasant neighbourhood walk. Definitely worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: musimom
Reviews.Content: My college aged daughter and I stayed here for 4 days on our first trip to Paris - we chose this hotel based on location, cost and reviews. We arrived early via Eurostar and as our room was not ready, the friendly hotel clerk stored our luggage so that we could begin enjoying our stay. The staff could communicate in English which was a relief as I do not know but basic greetings in French. They gave us a map and directions. We returned later that night and our luggage had already been brought up - how nice! On first inspection, our room looked clean and nice - updated tile bathroom w/shower and no mold! A wardrobe in the corner held a small safe and room to store luggage or clothes. We shared a double bed - no evidence of bed bugs seen :) - and we had a room facing the street which had long windows which opened up to get fresh air. We also had a flat screen t.v. mounted in the corner above a small fridge and Air conditioner. The fridge was stocked with drinks at a cost - we did not use this. The air conditioning worked great as did the t.v. The room was somewhat small but we expected this. Upon further investigation, I noted that the wallpaper had many water stains (water damage?) and fuzzies or hopefully just dust bunnies on the walls. The bed was really comfortable but the bed pad under the bottom sheet had hair all over it. I managed to get most of it off - yes, I am picky about cleanliness - shouldn't we all be what with the bed bug infestation going around! So it would've rated excellent except for the walls and bed pad. I believe this hotel has better rooms due to the reviews I read earlier. The location is great - close to two metros , Bon March Dept. store, a couple of restaurants, a good bakery next door, Le Jardin de Luxembourg is a short walk away, a food store -Le Epicurie I think it's called, by the Bon Marche, within walking distance to Rue Saint Germain where you will find lots of shops and restaurants - one of our favs was Cafe Deux Magot - touristy - yes, but great coffee and croissants! The hotel staff also stored our luggage (as our train left later in the evening) so that we could continue to explore Paris until we had to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Location,comfort, our Parisian home”
Reviews.Author: independent50s
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply wonderful and helped make our recent Parisian holiday so enjoyable . It is located in a vibrant area with restaurants, bars, shops, pattiseries, laundrette and supermarket within two blocks and 2 metro stations 10 minutes away. It is located in a very desirable area. The room was so quiet, if a little cosy but great shower and plenty of cupboard space. Double glazed window. Very friendly English speaking staff. It was a true home. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and peaceful in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: momalleycat
Reviews.Content: Staff were fantastic and very hepful. Rooms were spacious by Parisian standards and kept meticulosly clean during our stay. Great transport links via the metro to all of Paris from close by. A more affluent area of Paris and so felt safe and secure. Very happy with my week long stay will hopefully be back and recommending it to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ed_McCall
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be the best that we have stayed in Paris. The staff were wonderfully helpful and friendly, speaking to us in both French and English. The superior room we stayed in was spacious, clean and comfortable. Furthermore, the location was superb with a nearby metro as well as plenty of local shops and restaurants. When we return to Paris, we will most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need brighter lighting and english TV Channels”
Reviews.Author: ABG-11
Reviews.Content: Rooms for three should be larger. Otherwise the room redecoration was very nice. We've been staying at the Sevres for over 10 years

Reviews.Title: “This is my HOME in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Fpny
Reviews.Content: Since I sold my last apartment in Paris, before moving to NYC, ten years ago, this small hotel became home.I come here regularly 3/4 times a year: it is a wonderful location, the staff incredibly helpful, and I must admit than being a regular and old client, they are very friendly and helpful. I love hotels, I travel a lot, I am lucky to be able to check into fabulous hotels, but this one has really a home feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Break”
Reviews.Author: England-Paulg99
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris lots of time in the past, so this time decided to try the Rive Gauche. Found the Sevres Saint Germain using Trip Advisor. Lovely hotel great and friendly staff - helps if you speak some French. Quiet hotel in a fashionable area, very close to Metro and bus stops. Lots of lovely cafes and restaurants nearby. All you can eat buffet breakfast was very good value. Room was well appointed. Free wifi available in hotel - password provided at registration. Buy the Paris Visite bus/metro pass for easy travel around Paris. Use as hop on/hop off. Cheaper than a tour bus. Buy the museum pass at the quieter attractions then queue jump at the busier attractions, it represents great value if planning to visit several museums/attractions. The queues at popular attraction (Louvre, Pompidieu, Musee d'Orsay) can take hours. Bus route 69 from Tour Eiffel to Gambetta passes through heart of Paris Use one of several buses for a ride along the Champs Elysees. Paris is a great city at any time of the year. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scheinin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in Paris. This hotel recommended by friend. Staff was very helpful. Nice room, very clean. Great location for first time tourist. Walking distance to subway. Many cafe's nearby.

Reviews.Title: “a very good experience”
Reviews.Author: turistafeliceSalerno
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming, and the deluxe room is very confortable

Reviews.Title: “really nice 3-star hotel in a great location with reasonable prices and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: pommehomme
Reviews.Content: We love to stay in the St. Germain area of Paris when we visit and have stayed at a number of 2 and 3 star hotels. This may be the best of them all. It is clean with a great staff and reasonably sized rooms. The neighborhood is lively without being tourist ridden (like St. Germain can sometimes be!) There are good restaurants and shopping nearby. There is free wifi throughout the hotel. Compared to other 3-star hotels in the area, I believe the prices are quite good. I can't think of anything negative to stay about this place!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: AdanaAsli
Reviews.Content: clean room, helpful and friendly staff, great location

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value for money. Clean and cozy.”
Reviews.Author: pallaxxx
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Paris for a weekend with my wife. The hotel was overall really good. The room was very compact but that's expected in Paris. The bathroom / shower (again very small) was spotless and very recently renovated. Bed a little small but comfortable. Very helpful staff, always keen to help, point around, etc. Location for us was fantastic, on the edge of St. Germain district, very small and quiet street but close to lots of places and to 2 metro stations. I would definitely go back. P.S. - wifi included for free !!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: pizkinyu
Reviews.Content: area is nice. hotel is very nice and cozy. rooms are very very small.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely situated and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: nomadicweaver
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Sevres Saint Germain. There were plenty of cafes nearby but I recommend the breakfast at the hotel. Our room was always clean. We were located on the 4th floor (our ceiling was sloped which added to the room's character and coziness ... but we did knock our heads a few times.) Bon Marche is just steps away and a quaint morning farmer's market, subway and great restaurants are nearby. The St Germain/6th arrondissement is memorable and the Sevres Saint Germain a perfect home base.

Reviews.Title: “All round good value for cleanliness, staff and position”
Reviews.Author: Mrober
Reviews.Content: This is our fifth visit over 8 years. The hotel has maintained its consistency in cleanliness and friendliness. It is simple and elegant. The situation is ideal for a relaxing time whilst within easy reach of so many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ptlonsdale
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best hotel we stayed in during our five week trip to Europe. It is charming, and romantic, comfortable, cozy and welcoming. The staff were lovely and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: harryh87
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location within two blocks walking distance from excellent restaurants and a wide variety of stores for shopping, including the Bon Marche department store. The subway station is within one block allowing easy access to all parts of Paris. The staff were all very friendly and extremely helpful. The breakfast buffet was good and included both fresh fruit and fresh squeezed juice. The standard room was small but comfortable and bathroom functioned perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: iadoretravel
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with the reviews from Trip Advisor. I already knew it would be small so that wasn't surprising. I appreciated that it was air conditioned, something I would advise to look for when in Paris in August. The receptionists were very helpful, the location was very convenient. There had wi fi-though only one outlet. I would definitely return to this hotel, and I would also recommend it. . The best part was the Grande Epicerie which is the best food store you can imagine, right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Conor36
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Serves Saint Germain Hotel for two nights. It was our first time to visit Paris and we were recomended to stay in this area. Looking at other reviews it seemed that this hotel would satisfy our requirements. We arrived early on check in day and were delighted to be met by a very friendly and helpful receptionist. Our room was ready and we were given excellent advice on how to get the most from our stay in Paris. We expected the hotel to be small and it was. The room was basic in size and decor, it was however spotless. The staff were friendly helpful and professional. Breakfast was available at 15 euro per person but as there are so many cafes in the area offering good value we did not eat in the hotel, There was minimal facilities available but as a base to visit Paris this hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but very pleased by the experience and location.”
Reviews.Author: SBPaul
Reviews.Content: In a first trip to Paris, we found the hotel to be more than satisfactory, a pleasant surprise at a nice price; conveniently close to two Metro stations, fine neighborhood pastry shops, brasseries and much more. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, spotless room, friendly, professional front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: CrazyEye1
Reviews.Content: Between Rue de Rennes & Rue de Sevres, a half block from Bon Marche. Ideal shopping location for Paris fashion. Near multiple cafes, bistros, and metro access we were quite pleased with the location. Near the fun and restaurants of the Latin Quarter but removed on a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “great location in St Germain, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ggrant_10
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel within a stones throw of the"Bon Marche" department store and metro station, very friendly and extremely helpful staff, good breakfeast buffet, quiet

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly house, nice to come back again”
Reviews.Author: traveller2222_10
Reviews.Content: Wonderful. I always would come back to this house. Clean, friendly, calm street, good breakfeast, big room, our special wishes are fullfilled

Reviews.Title: “nice cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmckee483
Reviews.Content: We were in a room with shower, not bath. It was small. Would opt for the next size up (with bath). Staff was great. Room service fine. Only negative comment is that the location is to the edge of the 6th. We would prefer closer to the center of the 5th, Odeon, Saint Michel, etc.

Reviews.Title: “interesting”
Reviews.Author: arkelm
Reviews.Content: I'd like that the room was bigger and the breakfast was included in the price. The round is very nice, the basic amenities are near, good and high standard. I did everything I wanted, nice and easily. The people that work in hotel are helpful and competent.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: StephTravelin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Deluxe Two Twin room. It was so charming. The room was definately bigger than our room at the other hotel we stayed at in Paris this trip. We had plenty of room to move around and to put our luggage. The staff was very friendly and even helped us book a shuttle to the airport. And the location... it was less than a block from Le Bon Marche and Le Grande Epocerie de Paris. On Sundays there is a great organic market on Blvd Raspel. They had everything from wine, hot chocolate, cheese, meat to scarves and home made soaps.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice staff - all you need for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Schlump53
Reviews.Content: I just returned from two nights in this lovely hotel. It is in a wonderful neighborhood and perfectly located between two metro stops. The hotel is nicely decorated and the rooms must have been renovated not so long ago. Beds were great, in fact I slept better than in most luxurious hotels I stayed in. The rooms are on the small side, but that is what you get in a three-star hotel in a big European city. The decor and atmosphere is much better than average though! Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. Many thanks to the very friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “lovely stylish hotel, understated elegance”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveloholic
Reviews.Content: We got a wonderful four poster bed superior room at a very good price on a hotel booking website, I was very impressed when I came into the room. There was a separate loo from the bathroom which was also a pleasant surprise. The staff were charming and able to summon a cab in the pouring rain at a minute's notice.

Reviews.Title: “The pleasure was all ours”
Reviews.Author: taff89
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for our honeymoon, It was in a very nice area and was spotlessly clean. we chose to take breakfast on two occasions which was very nice indeed, the hotel is located centrally and close to the local metro giving access to all areas of Paris would highly recommend this hotel for mature couples looking for a relaxing time away.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: bplatinum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sevres Saint Germain hotel in late November on the recommendation of friends. We got a great rate and really enjoyed the neighborhood. We could tell the rooms had been renovated, and they were clean and fairly well appointed. The hallways are very narrow and dark, though, and the elevator is extremely small. The staff was wonderful - helping us with reservations and even allowing us to try out our limited French with them. They recommended some great restaurants and helped with travel plans. Given the rate, and being in such a great neighborhood, I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RMGDC
Reviews.Content: Small but comfortable room, spotlessly clean, extremely friendly desk staff, charming atmosphere. Only complaint was that CNN stopped working after the first day - but I wasn't in Paris to watch TV, so it didn't matter much at all!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modest hotel in Excellent area”
Reviews.Author: JeffreyJon
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel in the 6th arrondissement, convenient to metro and easily walkable to many points of interest. Staff was very accommodating, pleasant. 24 hour front desk. Gracious, quiet area off lobby for reading, a glass of wine. Not on the tourist hotel area. When I return to Paris, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice Paris comfort”
Reviews.Author: Goldatrip
Reviews.Content: A well-maintained property in an excellent neighborhood. Half a block to Le Bon Marche department store, plenty of restaurants nearby. Metro lines a few blocks away, but location great otherwise. Solid cleanliness and value, extremely helpful and friendly front desk people.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced-definitely not value for money!”
Reviews.Author: capuccinelondon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of positive comments on trip-advisor. So I feel obliged to complete a review because this spoilt our trip. first, we agreed a price online. When we came to confirm, reception attempted to charge a higher price. Yes, the hotel is well located but that is all. the rooms were small -that is tolerable- but not well-maintained. The breakfast was disappointing. We were surrounded by the most fantastic boulangeries-patisseries bu we were offered hard bread and mini croissants and pains au chocolat that are just like the ones which come pre-packed in supermarkets. The first morning the coffee was lukewarm. On the second morning i asked if we could have hot coffee. It was put in the microwave. The buffet was not kept well-stocked. It was necessary to ask for certain items.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: polywooda
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 19 year old daughter for 7 nights in this hotel. It was a mother-daughter trip. The room was a decent size for Paris and clean. We stayed in a superior double bed room. The walls were a little thin, but every night except one, the room was quiet. The staff was exceptional. They all spoke some, if not very good english, and were helpful with directions, suggestions and just everyday friendliness. The breakfast was good. It was 13 euros, but there was hard boiled eggs, croissants, fresh bread, jam, yogurt, fresh fruit, orange juice, coffee and tea. The elevator is a bit small, but was quick and efficient. Our trip was split up into a 4 night stay and a 3 night stay. Our room wasn't quite ready the second time, but we were offered a place for our luggage and an expresso. It was ready within 20 minutes. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was conveniently located and had wonderfully helpful staff that answered all of our questions, in English!”
Reviews.Author: DC-TravelingFools
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel by reading Trip Advisor and the reviews about cleanliness, location, friendly english speaking staff all were true. We would recommend this hotel to friends and family and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “a charming oasis in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: rogiebob
Reviews.Content: the service, ambience and overall graciousness excedded my expectations. I will recommend this to anyone interested in spending a few days in a charming and authentic environment.

Reviews.Title: “very quaint with escellence service, good location”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegosunshines
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. I brought my son this time - 24 years old. We enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The kitchen staff fixed my son a tray for me to take to him every morning as he slept in later than I did. There are metro stations at both ends of the street. Walking distance to cafes and shopping at Montparnasse, and the train station. Charming cafes and shops, and the Au Bon Marche - for fabulous food and gourmet snacks to take back to your room and home with you. They made taxi reservations for us for dinner each evening, and the taxis were always waiting for us when we arrived in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a wonderful area. Very French! Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine030
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I really enjoyed our first time in Paris with this lovely little hotel as our base. The staff was friendly, helpful and English speaking. We did so much in a short time and it was wonderful to come home to this wonderful hotel after each exhausting day. We took the Metro everywhere (get a Paris Visite card) and the location of the hotel was perfect! Our room was quite spacious, and overlooked the beautiful street and was surprisingly quiet. The bathroom was also spacious and immaculately clean. Will definitely stay here again, this time with my husband. Many wonderful restaurants and great shopping within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Accommodation for the price”
Reviews.Author: Coppergate
Reviews.Content: I recent stayed at the Sevres Saint Germain Hotel in Paris. The hotel has a relaxed boutique feel and is very reasonably priced. I also liked the location. The only drawback was that the room was a little tight, but that is normal for Paris. It was very clean and the staff was more than helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the frugal traveler. It is a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay with lovely hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: RoGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days and enjoyed the hospitality. From reading general reviews on Paris hotels our expectations were low (small and not too much clean room). We stayed in the superior room and it was large comftable and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very quiet. Great for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Ico_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not located in the touristic aera but in the very trendy aerea, close from the best shops. Staff was very friendly and available. Room was bigger than average hotel in Paris and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel next to Le Bon Marché”
Reviews.Author: Oesterbro
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not very big but the hotel is nice and clean. The staff is very welcoming and helpful. After a long day of walking and/or shopping you can enjoy a cup of coffee, tea or a glass of wine in the cosy lobby. In general the hotel has a very homey feeling to it. The area around is full of good shopping, nice restaurants, local market etc. We will stay there again next time we are in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: EhlyF
Reviews.Content: Very good stay for a romantic night. We are living very close to Paris but from time to time indulge ourselves with a romantic night in the city. This place was a very good one (specials requests - flowers and champagne) processed as desired, good bed, good breakfast. Minor default, some noise coming from the next room in the morning because of a thin wall. Worth to try this place.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel well situated in St Germain des Pres”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug0918
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying in this hotel. The room was very clean. The room had a North American style shower which we very much appreciated. The location of the hotel is great for exploring the area...lots of little boutiques, and good restaurants nearby. We would return.

HotelInfo.Name: Sevres Saint Germain Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 22 Rue Saint-Placide, 75006 Paris, France
